snippet: The censorship is another example of restrictions on news media freedom since the military takeover in July 2013 that put Abdel Fattah el-Sisi into power.
lead_paragraph: The censorship is another example of restrictions on news media freedom since the military takeover in July 2013 that put Abdel Fattah el-Sisi into power.
abstract: Egyptian authorities confiscate all copies of one of the country’s largest private newspapers in order to censor an article, just days after Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi vowed there would be no restrictions on free speech.

headline.main: Egypt Seizes Newspapers to Censor an Article

snippet:
Egypt, the most populous country in the Arab world, claims one of the world’s oldest cultures, descending from an ancient civilization that emerged in the 10th millennium BCE.

Widespread Middle East unrest in 2011...
lead_paragraph:
Egypt, the most populous country in the Arab world, claims one of the world’s oldest cultures, descending from an ancient civilization that emerged in the 10th millennium BCE.

Widespread Middle East unrest in 2011 loosed grievances against the 30-year autocratic rule of President Hosni Mubarak, who was ousted following a dramatic period of protest that became a watershed moment in the Arab Spring. This upheaval paved the way for the country’s first free parliamentary elections, in which the Muslim Brotherhood leader Mohamed Morsi was elected president. Subsequent protests against Morsi’s authoritarianism led to a 2013 military coup d’etat and the election of former general Abdel Fattah el-Sisi as president in 2014.

Learn more about Egypt. Scroll below to view our archive of articles and chronology of latest news.

headline.main: Egypt

abstract: Memo From Cairo; Egyptian Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi returns from first visit to United Nations to widespread acclaim; Egyptians perceive Sisi's UN address as transformational moment in which he was accepted as a legitimate statesman by the international community; Sisi has consolidated exceptional control in his home country, building a cult of personality and capitalizing on fear of the chaos that has engulfed surrounding countries.

headline.main: As Egyptians Grasp for Stability, Sisi Fortifies His Presidency
headline.print_headline: As Egyptians Grasp for Stability, Sisi Fortifies His Presidency
